description: A very tasteful coffee and bakery is what you will find here. There are many options to choose from and the women who work in here are extremely nice and welcoming. This a great place to stop and relax at.
author: Becky G.

description: Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I stopped here while spending a weekend in San Francisco and were so please once we got our food! I got the Chicken Pesto Panini and my boyfriend got the Turkey Dijon Panini and we were both extremely satisfied! The salad served with is was also very fresh! The prices were great and the food was delicious! I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Haight and Ashbury!
author: Madee W.

description:
I usually get Nichole's panini bc of the bacon turkey havarti and aoili bc it's heaven. They all come with a  side salad and balsamic vinaigrette. I like adding the arugula to my sandwich and luring the vinaigrette on top. It's delicious. 

They also have a selection of  kettle cooked chips. Yerba mate pellegrinos. There are some tables for you to sit as well. Buena vista Park is nearby if you wanna also just sit and chill to eat
author: Cecilia H.

description: It's freezing outside and we open the door it's super warm very welcoming vibe from walking in outside cold as greeted with a comforting hello at the door and great coffee inexpensive too !!! They have WiFi you can connect with if you've got to do work great place
author: Najla B.

description: I honestly wasn't planning on reviewing this place. I mostly just came in here and bought something to use their restroom. But, dang. I liked their panini. Avo Spinach Veggie panini + side salad for only $7.50. Pretty lit pricing for a popular neighborhood in SF, huh? I'd say so. And delicious, too. Also, the staff was friendly-- they were nice to order from and I witnessed them kindly help a girl mop up her large spill of iced tea. Plus, I mean, "don't be a weenie, get a panini..!"
author: Hannah J.

description:
Panini is the cheapest place for breakfast in the Upper Haight, and one of the cheapest for lunch. $4-8.50

Espresso and coffee drinks are definitely not bad, though also not higher end. They sell some muffins and pastries, as well as candies/chocolate bars from the U.K.! So certain tourists need not fear about withdrawals from their beloved Crunchie bars. ;)

It's small but has a little table in the front bay window, which can comfortable seat 4 people and is great for human/animal watching!

Paninis, their name sake, are very good, huge, and come with a good amount of spring mix as a side salad. Chances are, unless you're ravenous or are splitting an order with someone else, that you will have leftovers. If you're not in a position to take them home, give em to a Haight Street kid! Otherwise, hooray for leftovers!
author: Megan D.

description: They sell random British chocolate so I come here as it's down my street. Their paninis are also really good, have tried the chicken one and would recommend it.
author: Mira B.

description: My chicken pesto panini is uninspiring. Bread and chicken are dried up and don't seem fresh. Will not go out of my way to eat here.
author: Demin G.

description:
My conversation with my friend...
Me: So what's there to eat around here for lunch?
Friend: Well, we can get a panini at Panini or...blah blah blah...
Me: Let's get a panini. 

I didn't quite understand that the restaurant was actually called "Panini" until we got there.  But, it is aptly named since they offer solid paninis.  Although, I wish there were a few more options.  Two of the options were blotted out when we arrived but I think one had brie (the best cheese invented ever) so I wish I could have tried that one! 

I ordered the pesto chicken and it was delish...the cheese was all gooey and the pesto seemed legit fresh (maybe homemade, I think?).  Also, the paninis come with a small salad of mixed greens with balsamic dressing which is a perfect balance.

Service was super quick and friendly.  Tables are awkwardly narrow and I think there are only three of them.
author: Jess Y.

description: I was a super loyal customer of this place and literally ordering every single week. Today this material came inside my sandwich! I called them and mentioned about this and all they said is "we make good sandwiches but sorry about that". Really!?!? I have nothing to say, just check the picture! I am glad that I was eating slow so I didn't break my teeth and/or swallow this!
author: Giselle S.

description: Yummy, fresh lil local spot with great service, selection of paninis, bagels, pastries, little empanada turnovers. I get the California bagels but on sourdough toast, you can add arugula or spinach for a nice afternoon snack or light lunch. Healthy, flavorful (they even S&P it!), and cheap, affordable prices.
author: Marina M.

description:
Bomb egg muffin sandwiches!

They've got drinks in their fridge like coconut water, orange juice, chocolate milk, etc.
Also sell pastries, KIND bars, chips.

Thanks, Panini dudes!
author: Lauren L.

description: Was in San Fran for a day backpacking with my brother, was craving a panini at the time & found this place right up the street from where we were. Great location right on Haight-Ashbury. Very friendly workers & very good paninis. Get a salad and a panini all for a decent price! Will most definitely be coming back next time I'm in the city!
author: Jenna S.

description:
My favorite is the chicken pesto panini with a side salad for about $7.50 
Usually a very short wait for food, 10 minutes. 
if you're on a crunch, call in for pick up. 

Large selection of panninis. 
I wish they put more dressing on the salad. Sometimes I get like 3 dribbles of dressing and it's gets too dry for me to eat. 

Parking is a bit difficult depending on the time of your arrival of course.
author: Jess W.

description:
I always go to Pork Store next door and never really noticed that this was more than just a coffee shop... But I ordered pick up on the way between Bed Bath and Beyond and home on a mission to put up new curtains and wanted something light and fast. 

Ordered two salads, they were both really good and $7.50 without meat. Will be hitting this place up again when I'm looking for a cheap tasty salad. Given the name, I should probably try their paninis too but this review is for only take out salads. 

Prob not a sit down place if you're not going for the small coffee house vibe.
author: Nikki D.

description: Probably the best sandwich I have ever had. The Avo spinach veggie panini is delicious.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Finally got to try this place after bookmarking on yelp since they've opened

Came with husband and baby and we ordered a chicken pesto panini and chicken arugula panini. It came out toasted and both with a side salad. 

The panini's were both pretty good. I think the arugula panini had a little more flavor than the pesto one but both was tasty. 

They have a few other panini options, salads and drinks. Place is small with a few tables. I would come here again if I was in the area. The service was friendly too.
author: Fiona T.

description:
I think I just found my new favorite spot on Haight! I asked the girls at the counter for a suggestion on a Panini & they recommended the Mozzarella Basil & Pesto Chicken! I went with the Pesto Chicken & it was soooo good! It also comes with a small side salad. I'm definitely going to be back  :) 
P.S. Music in this place is on point
author: Nikki S.

description:
Just thought I would write an update.
Everything is still great. Its nice to find a place
that you can count on to be good every time!
author: Simon The Cat -.

description: really good sandwiches and salads. Best sandwich in SF no doubt. I'm a huge meat eater and i decided to take a break from meat for a month, so i ordered an organic roasted yams sandwich and a mozzarella basil panini sandwich. Both great choices if you want something simple but they dont lack flavor at all. I know many of you are like yam sandwich? are you kidding? but it all comes together and now this is my go to sandwich spot in SF. The panini bread is top notch as well and all the sandwiches come with a nice little side salad. Check this place out!
author: Stony S.

description:
Been here several times now. The sandwiches, especially the hot ones are fantastic. Love them. Also, their pizza slice and a soda for $3.50 is a great deal. I'm not a pizza connoisseur, but this stands out. The crust is the best part which is the sign of a good pizza in my mind. 

Prices for the sandwiches are good too, especially for what you are getting. Beats Subway, which is not even in the same league, and it's only a dollar or so more.
author: Stephen D.

description: Service was fantastic and personal.  Sandwiches were delicious.  I really enjoyed this find, its value and the tasty meal.
author: Kris C.

description:
3 people working and not much work being  done. The gal with the soft cast did all the work. Sandwich was okay. I mistakenly grabbed the wrong sandwich, I just figured it was mine since I had been waiting the longest and I misunderstood what she said, language barrier, haight barrier, unsure, I apologized and she was real snappy about it, you have a bad attitude Ms. 
Not worth the wait, I could have eaten at the pork store in the amount of time I waited for my bacon, egg, cheese sandwich. Lesson learned.
author: Travis B.

description: I used to live right above this place! Not a bad spot. Lavazza coffee and espresso, decent sandwiches that come with a little side of greens. Simple, but good neighborhood option.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
One of the few tolerable places on this area of Haight, by far!

Went in today around 130ish and had the pleasure of being helped by two angels.
The bagel sandwiches are great, the paninis are great and the service is even better.
You know you went somewhere enjoyable when you're already thinking of what you want to get next time.

Thanks again, guys!
author: Natalie M.

description: Food was ok.. But watched the guy make my salad with his hands entirely. Also forgot my chicken and avocado on my CHICKEN Cesar salad. Rude af.
author: Cassidy M.

description: Super friendly and an excellent sandwich and coffee. New favorite place to grab a panini, that's for sure!
author: Xóchitl B.

description: OMG YUM super great menu and the staff is super kind. I definitely recommend this place for breakfast and lunch!
author: Alice J.

description: me and my b had empty stomachs and were craving for panini's and thought oh panini in the haight sounds cool so we headed over there and guys working the counter were nice and friendly. I ordered the chicken caesar sandwich and ate it up but then 20 mins later it made me super gas-y and I asked my b, hey I just farted so do you feel gas-y too? ho behold he was too. maybe it was that the Caesar dressing was cookin up in the oven getting bubbly or that the chicken wasn't fresh, who really knows?
author: Laurie M.

description: I love this place! It's super cheap with a good amount of quality food. I bought a banana and veggie panini which came with a salad and a really delicious dressing for under $10.
author: Julia A.

description: A hidden gem in Michigan City.  Panini Panini is a European cafe experience.  All the homemade menu items from the breads, soups, salads, sandwiches, entrees, and desserts are amazing!
author: Heidi A.

description: Great sandwich/salad place in the Haight. Feels healthier than alternatives in the area like Squat and Gobble, Pork Store Cafe, etc.  I got the Palms Deluxe Salad with chicken to go and a ginger ale, totaled to around $11. The salad was fresh, delicious, extremely filling. The lady who ran the shop was extremely nice. Would definitely go back to get the salad again or try the paninis.
author: Katie C.

description:
I will be the first to admit... I can be a food snob ;) Sandwiches sitting in the display case ready to be grilled and marked a panini- psssh, that's not fresh! But I dare you to prove me wrong and that's exactly what Panini did. In fact, this is possibly the best panini I have ever tried. Really!

Right now I am in love with the Mozzarellini. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/F8TmIgBbBXt7JD1Naiwktg?select=AVWwuaTh37P3atvv-xP0Ag

Everything was fresh! The bread, tomatoes, basil and of course, the mozzarella - melted perfectly! There was a hint of balsamic vinegar or it could have been the Italian seasoning concoction baked with the tomato, basil and mozzarella. Yes, baked. They grill the panini and also bake it which makes the cheese extra gooey and the bread has a nice, crisp crust. As if that's not enough, it comes with a nice side salad with a light balsamic vinaigrette. 

Panini is an absolutely great Haight Street eatery!
author: S Y.

description: Best breakfast sandwich I had in a long time. Small place with nice atmosphere, quaint tables and seating, good customer service, reasonable prices. I can't believe I didn't know about this place in two years living in SF and spending lots of time in Haight.
author: Hugh M.

description: What a fun little place to grab a bite to eat!  I walked in for an impromptu early dinner while out shopping in the area.  It's just a small little sandwich shop where they'll press your panini for you, serve you some sweets (like zucchini bread, cookies, and rice krispies treats), you can pick some chips and a drink, if you'd like, too.  There are a few tables set up to eat inside.  The staff is friendly, and the panini I order (Nicole's) was just melt in your mouth amazing!  There are so many places to grab a bite from around the Haight, but this is definitely worth the stop.
author: Jes G.

description: Hella good, owner is funny and cool
author: Daniel B.

description: Usually, I love this hip cafe. But today I waited 24 minutes for a latte. I've been a barista for 10 years and that's unacceptable. The cashier was rude and when she gave me a medium latte instead of the small I ordered, she just poured it into a small cup. Anyone who knows anything about lattes knows that messes up the ratio. Whole milk makes my stomach queasy and I can't drink a milky drink without getting sick. Also there was no hint of the vanilla I paid for. I used to love this place, but maybe it's gone downhill.
author: Christine K.

description:
This is a respectable little hole in the wall, perfect for grab and go bites and drinks.  

Following an afternoon of record shopping at Amoeba, I ambled along Haight, eager to find a late lunch of the sandwich variety.  I happened upon Panini and am very glad for that.  

The display case showcases the pre-assembled sandwiches, just waiting to be toasted and served.  I was excited to see the Chicken Arugula behind the glass, so I went for it.  I dont know if they'll freshly make one of their sandwiches for you if it isn't already assembled behind the glass.  I'd hope so, but it may just take longer.  While my panini was being pressed, the girl behind the counter did get out some fresh bread and began (I assume) assembling new sandwiches to replenish the available stock.  

I was impressed that my sandwich (with accompanying side salad) came out to less than $10 with tax and tip included.  Because in sf these days, apparently sandwiches and burritos have decided it's ok to make it into the double digits.  Thankfully, not here.  

I was most impressed though by the taste.  Everything tasted fresh, there was the perfect amount of aioli, and the melted cheese paired with the slightly crispy bread was pretty much divine.  I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of this panini.  I'll definitely return.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: My favorite neighborhood breakfast sandwich! Cheap, fast and quality. Every time I come here I get the sausage and cheese breakfast sandwich and I love that they make it from scratch. They use a real egg and cook it in this little oven...but it's amazing!! Coffee is good, as well.
author: Anne K.

description:
I really love Panini because it's sort of a hidden gem, convenient, and has pretty great prices (in general, not just for Haight).

The coffee is good (fairly bold and full-bodied, which I like), but what I really love is the California bagel sandwich. It's got sprouts, avocado, and tomato - simple and to the point - on whatever kind of bagel you'd like (at Panini I tend to go for the sesame). It's less than five bucks, solid, and it's really good at any time of the day.

Only thing is - they run out of bagels quickly (it's a popular request and they open early, so it's understandable), so if you're going for any bagel sandwich, try to stick to breakfast hours.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
Third chances.

Did I go to a place called Panini and not get a panini? My yelp from September 2008 would suggest so. Hate when I'm not paying attention.

Which means I need to go back for thirds. Started 2013 with a veggie sausage and egg muffin. Complicated? No. Delicious, quickly made and just four bucks? Yes.

Great service. And a great reason to go back.
author: Jason B.

description: Very cute little café with reasonable prices. The barista was nice and did a great job with my macchiato. I also had the chicken pesto sandwich which was pretty good although a bit on the greasy side -even by pesto sandwich standards. Will visit again if I find myself in San Francisco.
author: Eleana M.

description: Went here for a soy latte while waiting in line for breakfast next door, pretty standard SF Haight area, an eclectic crowd after the hot chocolate marathon and scrumptious coffee.  I would stop by again if I was in the area, the artwork was fantastic, it was quiet and it had free wifi.  What more could you want from a coffee shop?
author: Sara N.

description:
Solid coffee drinks and a nice selection of paninis. I should note that the paninis seem to be pre-assembled and then toasted to order, so your choice panini may not be available depending on the time of day.

Overall, enjoyable.
author: Chung N.

description: Spent $3.50 for a chai latte + a $1 tip. The place has breakfast sandwiches and salads and espresso drinks but i only got a chai. Small space but they accept card so thats a plus. People were nice but the environment in here isnt the kind you would come just to sit in and chat, more like a grab and go. The chai was bitter and not sweet at all, and it was cold, probably only steamed to like 110 degrees. No bueno. Worst $4.50 i've spent all week, probably wouldn't come back as there are so many other coffee shops on Haight. My drink was disgusting but two stars for the nice people and not being a cash only place
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Delicious chicken pesto panini.
Heads up they only have three tables in this joint.
author: Varun V.

description:
I was with a friend who, through some miracle, had never eaten a panini before. I prayed that this place would be delicious so he wouldn't have a  bad first impression of the magic sandwich that is the panini. 

The place appeared to be family run, and they were training their little girl (about 13 or 14 maybe) to work the cash register so it was a little slow. She kept counting my change wrong. I ordered the Turkey Dijon and my friend the Italian. 

Our paninis came in little boxes with a little salad. The salad was topped with a great balsamic vinaigrette and I wolfed down those greens faster than I've ever eaten a salad. The paninis were warm and delicious, and while they weren't more special than any other panini I've had, they certainly were tasty.

A few hours later, after shopping around on Haight, my friend was really thirsty. Feeling like he'd eaten too much sugar recently, he just wanted a cup of water. We went back to Panini and he asked them for a cup, which they surprisingly gave to him after learning we had had lunch there. Great customer service!
author: Cindy Z.

description: I've only ordered the chicken pesto panini from here, but it is freakin' delicious! It comes with a lightly dressed salad on the side as well.  I'll have to try the other sandwiches next time.
author: Marc B.

description: My wife came in and had a macchiato. I can't stand coffee. My wife was just complaining about how coffee on Haight is really mediocre at best and then we followed our nose into this little place. The paninis look tasty (like ones we saw while traipsing around Europe last summer) but she only had the macchiato on this trip.  She won't stop raving about the coffee, so it must be good.
author: Don P.

description: This spot is great for a better than your average egg sandwich, it's inexpensive and the service is top notch. I recommend double egg and cheese with sausage on an english muffin.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
After shopping for a couple of hours with my mom, we were so exhausted and hungry but both of us (me especially) are the most indecisive people when it comes to deciding where to eat. We came across this place after just walking by and happening to take a minute break to finally decide where we were going to eat. The menu caught my eye and I started reading about the delicious paninis and salads, it was decided this was it! 

The inside is a little small, cramped for seating space. The girls working were so friendly! I ordered the Palms Deluxe salad (BEST SALAD I'VE EVER HAD HANDS DOWN!!), which came with spring mix lettuce, fresh avocado, feta cheese, sun dried tomatoes, cucumbers and a delicious balsamic dressing. I can't for the life of me remember the name of my mom's salad because I was obviously way too busy and focused on my own plate of heaven. But her salad came with spring mix lettuce, cucumber, fresh mozzarella cheese, cilantro and the balsamic dressing as well. I also ordered an iced coffee, which was so yummy and strong.

Try this place, definitely. You won't regret it. I wish I didn't live so far away or else this would be my go-to place everyday. But it's definitely my go to place every time I'm in Haight from now on. I was so impressed!
author: Theresa A.

description: Nodding my head while eating the best chicken pesto panini. #GoodMorningWorld. Perfect chill eatery.
author: Damien S.

description:
I was CRAVING a Panini and so I went online to seek out one. It's AMAZING how few places in the city make Panini. I miss Europe for that....

I found one in the Haight called Panini. Since I work relatively close to the haight I  decided to give it a try. Upon arrival the Smell was divine. My only hope was the sandwich would be half as good. I ordered the Chicken Pesto w/ Sun dried Tomato and provolone and the Nicole's Panini (Turkey, Havarti, Avocado, bacon and Tomato) Panini for a friend. These are ready made sandwiches, warmed and pressed to perfection. When I returned to the office they were still warm and ready to be devoured. My coworker and I shared our sandwiches to taste them both. We equally agreed that the Nichole's Panini was Delicious and hands down our favorite. The Chicken pesto was a bit disappointing to be honest. I would expect it to be far more flavorful and juicy and we found it a bit dry. I will be returning again for the Nicole's sandwhich. 

Overall, if you are in the Haight and looking for a quick little bite to eat, I would suggest this place. Simple Menu, Fresh ingredients and convenient.
author: Shelby D.

description: Loved my sandwich! They had a Sandwich called the Nichole, spelled the same way as I do! so I had to get it and it was soooo good. My sister got the pesto chicken and actually ate the whole thing (a rare occation). Cheap prices too and you get a sandwich and a small salad with really good dressing. Would deffinatly go again.
author: Nikki H.

description: Although it is tiny and a bit toasty inside, the sandwiches are top notch as is the interaction with the lovely people who work at the place.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Holy crap, the Nichole's Panini is to die for!! My mouth is watering just thinking about it!! Turkey, havarti cheese, bacon, avocado, tomato, grilled to perfection...yum! The chicken pesto panini is pretty delicious too :-)
They also give you a little salad with the paninis and the dressing they use is also awesome!

The restaurant itself is teeny tiny, it might fit 10-15 people at one time max. I always get it to go and eat at home. They have a unique selection of drinks, however they have been out of Sanpelegrino Limonata recently...boo!

Love this place!
author: Erin H.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 5/5
Wait: 4/5
Price: $
Portions: 4/5
Presentation of food: 5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 5/5




Omg! i just went here today! And i am in looove with this place. its so cute here, its a little joint and their Paninis are extremely yummy! i had their Chicken Pesto for whopping $6.50! + a small side salad included. mmmm. yummmmm, very friendly. The panini was nice and hot, cheese melted onto the chicken, even though its white meat and im not a fan of white meat, but the PESTO sauce was a great touch where it didnt bother me that it was white meat chicken :) the side salad was good too, not like a cheap type of salad that just tossed into the meal. the dressing for the salad was really good as well. im def. going here for paninis from now on!
author: Eva H.

description:
Sometimes you get a Panini that's still cold in the middle but Panini's paninis are toasty and warm to the core.  The secret?  Panini not only uses a Panini grill but they use a convection oven too.  While you have to wait a longer time for your sandwich, the end result is a true delight.  

I had the Tofunini ($7.05).  The bread is soooo good. It's extra crunchy on the outside while still soft on the inside.  I love the lightly grilled medium firm tofu slab - it's truly for those who appreciate the flavor of tofu.  You know who you are - you like plain, uncooked tofu even better than marinated tofu.  The tofu adds a soft, creaminess to the sandwich which works so well with the arugula, red onions and juicy portabello mushrooms.  

I still like the side salad with the delicious balsamic vinaigrette, but it does wilt quickly in the carryout box.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Being up in the Haight for a friend's tattoo appointment, we stopped by this little cafe to grab a quick bite to eat as the artist was running late.  She grabbed the turkey sandwich, I got the tomato/mozzarella panini, as well as drinks from the small selection of pop, juice, water, etc.  

My panini was a very pleasant surprise!  The ingredients were fresh and flavourful and the small salad in the box was unexpected but rounded out the quick meal quite nicely.  

For a quick bite to eat, this is a decent place to stop.  The seating is a bit crowded and it's not a place I'd want to sit and chat at for a long period of time (I'd be considerate to other customers that were coming in), but it's a quaint little treasure on Haight street.  Price was right on too.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Came here for lunch. I got a mozarella tomato basil panini. it was really delicious, nothing mind blowing though. They didn't have a great drink selection so i settled for an orange vitamin water which isn't my favorite. My boyfriend loves the place though so maybe I just didn't get the right thing.
author: Alexandra W.

description: YESSSS!!  I am obsessed with this place! Honestly a hidden gem. I wake up craving their Chicken Arugula panini and travel to Haight solely to get this sandwich. It's THAT good. Their balsamic is the secret.
author: Lynn M.

description: Cheat day...walked over here and grabbed a chicken pesto. It was very tasty and came out quickly. Loved that it came with a side salad instead of fries as well. Service was prompt, friendly and both girls greeted me with a big smile.
author: Michael K.

description: This place hits the spot! Every bite is just amazing and the entire stuff is really friendly. Very cool vegan options :)
author: Markus F.

description:
I'll file this under the "I just don't get it" category.

The paninis are fine.  Kind of pricey for what it is.  Loved the one with brie, but the turkey dijon didn't do much for me.  The salad with heavy vinaigrette dressing was way oily, and the drink selection is limited and overpriced.  

Granted, perhaps I'm biased being a fan of People's Cafe and Blue Front, but I just think there's more interesting options as far as sandwiches go on Haight Street.
author: John H.

description: Had the chicken pesto panini, came with a side salad and I got a bag of chips, $9.71.  Overall the sandwich was a bit bland and kind of greasy.  Probably won't come back again.
author: sam h.

description:
A sweet, lil shop with a menu of sammy delights. The brie, cantaloupe and prosciutto was decent, but lived on the grill for moments too long - changing the brie from goey to almost gone. But the fruit and meat were a winning taste combo. 

For the small, slightly grimy space, I was impressed that my sandwich was brought out to me on a white plate with a side salad. Dressing flavour? That's go time! I just wish there was less of it, as I fished my lettuce out of the streams of sauce. 

Worth a stop in for a quick bite!
author: Crystal H.

description:
Ho-hum.

If you're walking up and down Haight and you are desperate for a pesto chicken panini sandwich, it's a pretty good deal. But it's nothing special. 

I've tried a few of their other sandwiches and they didn't impress me, but I also wasn't disappointed. Say Cheese up in Cole Valley is more expensive, but for the price-quality ratio, it's much better option... if you have the time and don't mind walking up the hill.
author: Hannah L.

description:
I was walking on Height St last saturday and I was drawn by the great coffee smell only to find out that one of the owners "George" makes the best paninis in town. I got the Chicken Pesto Sandwich, triple yum.
I probably will stop by tonight after work to get a different flavor.
I little birdy told me that they may be selling Nucha Empanadas pretty soon, what a great combo!

Gabriel
author: Gabriel G.

description: I can only think that the 4 stars are for the food and definitely not for the service. I had the Italiano and the serving came with a little side salad. It was very tasty and I wanted to go there again but the service was horrible. Really slow service and the two ladies just really looked like they wanted to be home in bed sleeping (I was there around noon) and really it's a shame because the place could be great.
author: Sarah H.

description: I ordered the Palms Salad w/ goat cheese and pecans with extra avocado + tomato + fresh basil + balsamic/olive oil for dressing. It was awesome. I ordered it via  phone and the girl who helped me was friendly and super patient with all my little changes. I arrived 5 minutes later and my salad was done. I was in a rush but figured since my food was done already I could order coffee. She put the soy milk in for me and everything. Five stars for my bomb, fresh, take out salad!
author: Brandileigha S.

description: Panini is a great neighborhood sandwich joint that most of the tourists don't wander into so you don't have to wait forever to get your food. :-)  The turkey bacon panini is delicious and it comes with greens and dressing on the side.   Great for lunch, although beware that they close rather early (around 7 I think but they stop making sandwiches about 20-30 mins before that).
author: Emily T.

description:
Cons:
1) The prices are higher than the ones reflected on the online menu!
2) The veggie avacado panini came with no avacado! I got bread and tomatoes on my plate for 8$. Please, no!

 Pros:
1) Fast internet.
2) Good view of the people walking on haight.
author: A P.

description:
Good idea - affordable Panini on Haight. Bad execution - made me ill.

The "french" panini consisted of brie cheese that was baked to evaporation, a prosciutto that was more like a tasteless ham, and giant slabs of cantaloupe which overpowered any flavor.

The yelp photos are misleading. The salad entailed a few leafs of bag lettuce and a decent vinaigrette.

The alternative: For a similarly priced panini and salad, blue bottle coffee and a televised soccer match, go to Velo Rouge on Arguello instead.
author: christopher r.

description: Food is fine. But its kind of dirty... Just have a look on the toilets, and on the flys over the croissants.
author: Sebastien M.

description:
This Review is from 01/14/2012

Paninis rock as does this place, they make the best Panani I've ever had hands down consistently!!!  They are even part of Stampt, which is Mobile Application punch card where you can get a free Pananini after purchasing 10.  I've been to this place at least 3 times now and it's always been awesome and the girls working there are friendly.  Get the Chicken Arugula Panini it rocks.
author: Arthur Z.

description:
My friend was getting a tattoo & I wasn't, so I decided to wander off for some gruuub! I had no idea what to eat because I don't hang around Haight very often. In fact, I was searching for a pizza place; but I was walking in the wrong direction. Oops!

Well. My boyfriend knows this place very well, but he was busy so I snuck away to get some food on my own. I walked past this place and figured, hey why not? There's one table left and I'll sit there to eat :).

I was pretty much confused when I walked in because there was nobody at the register to take my order!! The man who was making food asked what I would like, so I ordered a chicken pesto panini. A woman came to the register, I got an organic lemonade. It was all only about $9!!! Awesome. :)

I waited a while, and more people came in. I was just hoping that nobody would take that single table!!! Luckily, everyone was getting food to go. So I got my chicken pesto panini and it came with a salad. Mm the salad was pretty damn yummy :). Then I ate my panini. Ooomg!!! It was crunchy and cheesy and perfect!!

Well my boyfriend realized I was gone and came searching for me. :( I had to share my amazing panini with him!! Grrrr D:
Needless to say, I will be back. And next time, he's getting his own. :D
author: Erica A.

description: Cool spot to go to for some coffee.  Amazing that whenever I'm looking for coffee in the Haight, that this is the closest place to me.  Anyways, the homies from Hawaii came thru and we did the Haight.  And this spot too for a Lavazza Mocha.  Well done with the whipped cream too!  It's nice, warm and cozy in this little shop.
author: Limzer L.

description: I had the Yam and Goat Cheese panini, and I really enjoyed it. Will definitely be going back to try the others. The Chibata was crispy without being too hard. The women working the place were happy and very pleasant. Definitely recommend.
author: Steven G.

description:
I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars.  I would give 3.5 if I could, but I can't.  

First off, the good part of my panini experience.  I got the grilled tofu panini and it was delicious!  The creaminess of the tofu went really well with the mushroom.  I didn't know what to expect but I love tofu, and I love mushrooms and I love bread and salad.  What can go wrong?  NOTHING!  Pure yumminess!  

The reason why I didn't give this place 4 stars or even 5 is because the side salad my sandwich came with wasn't cleaned properly!  Yuck-O!  I bit into several grains of sand!  Double yuck-O!  I know it wasn't just me because my co-worker experienced the same thing.  I'm sad about this because my panini was soooo good.  And it's still good enough for me to go back even though the salad was dirty.  I'm hoping this was some fluke incident.  I'd go back and try it again and I hope you guys are reading this because I really love your tofu panini and I really don't want to eat sand.  :(
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Really really good sandwiches for awesome prices. I had the chicken pesto - so delicious and flavorful. It was kind of oily but that didn't stop me from polishing off the entire thing haha. It's a hole in the wall cafe so they aren't the speediest...I think they only have 2, maybe 3 people max, behind the counter working - making sandwiches and taking orders. So yea, come with patience ;)

Panini offers salads ($7-9), sandwiches ($6-8), coffee and various pastries. All the sandwiches come with a side salad....you can definitely split an order if you're not too hungry.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
After walking around Haight we wanted to pick up some sandwiches to bring with us to Golden Gate Park for a picnic. We walked into Panini and we were the only ones in there! That rarely happens in SF, haha. So we decided to take advantage of it and we just ate there instead of getting it to go. 
Lots of things looked good and it took me forevvverrr to decide. But ultimately i settled on the Palms Deluxe Salad which was romaine + spring mix w/ goat cheese, sun dried tomatoes, cucumbers, candied pecans & balsamic. And i decided to add chicken to it as well. It was delciousss! But when  i got my salad the girl forgot to put the chicken on it but immediately realized it so she ran back to the kitchen and brought it out. To drink i got a large iced tea (which was only $2.50 btw), expecting it to be regular black tea, but when i got it it was like the passion fruit crap from Starbucks :( Bummer. Oh well. 
I don't remember what my friends ordered but i remember that they enjoyed it. The only thing that i have to say is lame about this place is the seating. The tables in here are SO small. But i suppose this place isn't very big so it probably couldn't fit much else. 
Next time i'm around, i'll have to give one of their delicious looking paninis a try.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Unassuming, straightforward, affordable and satisfying panini served by friendly people.  Avoid the myriad of shit pits in the Upper Haight and give this place your business.  

I can vouch for Nichole's Panini and the Italian.

Man, that sounded naughty.
author: Eric R.

description:
I found this place on urban spoon and it turned out to be super awesome. The atmosphere was great, clean, and good music! (they were playing classic rock when I visited). The food was delicious. I got Nicoles panini and it was crafted to perfection with great meat and produce - plus it came with a nice side salad. I also enjoyed some of their iced coffee which was of high quality (I work in a coffee shop). The customer service was top notch. The staff were very friendly and warm. It seemed to be a family run shop which really shows. 

Good food at good prices! :)
author: John L.

description: This place does not look like much on the outside but what lies within is great food and super friendly food-makers. I've only ever gotten the vegetarian paninis, (there are a few) so I couldn't vouch for the meat ones. But the carrot cake is also pretty bomb and they have a great drink collection to choose from. And cookies! It's one of the few places on Haight street not plagued by tourists as well, which is a plus.
author: Amy S.

description: I had a pretty great experience here the other day.  My friend's tardiness forced me to seek shelter in a cafe.  I usually don't like doing this because I have to buy something and I don't fancy coffee.  I was starving and jonesing for a snack.  The mini carrot cakes were simply too entrancing to resist.  And while there was far too much frosting (when is that ever a bad thing?!?) and the plastic wrap make the whole business quite sticky, the treat was just what I needed.  Best of all was the service.  The girl at the counter was friendly, funny, and exceedingly helpful.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Kind of rough when the name of the place is Panini and the panini's aren't so good.  Don't think I'll be back.
author: Shane T.

description:
It's all very well to flit about the city sampling one restaurant after another, but if you've ever had a standing after-work meeting somewhere, then you know the value of having a fast, cheap, and reliable place that you can eat at week in, week out.  In my case I needed something in the Haight, and relative newcomer Panini fits the bill perfectly.

The name is plain and so is the interior, but this modest little cafe churns out the best paninis I have yet found in SF--hands down.  Every bite melts in your mouth, the cheese is abundant, the bread is quality, the flavors are myriad (yams or canteloupes, anyone?), and the portions are generous (am I the only one who thinks most places make paninis too small?).  The owner is quite friendly too, hopefully even more so if this is the place where I finally achieve "regular" status.
author: Wes M.

description: I went there this past weekend and had the chicken pesto, the chicken pesto is really good, a bit greasy... full of flavor though. The sizes are uneven though, my BF was dissapointed because his was smaller. One thing I thought was weird that they have a picture with a Panini and a side salad, I assumed they would give one but they didn't. I wouldn't have a poster in the front of your store with a panini and a side salad unless it came with it. Overall it was tasty and I would go back if I was looking for a sandwich on height.
author: Lisa W.

description:
MY MOST FAVORITE Panini place EVER!
I love THE STAFF, especially the girl that works there.
I come to S.F. to visit my friend every month and to go shopping and this place is ALWAYS on my list of things to do, every time! They caught my attention because of the Nichole's panini (my name) i saw on the sign outside one day, and i tried it, and fell in love. I recommend this to everyone.
author: Nichole M.

description: I LOVED this place. Walked in, got a table looking out on Haight, ordered and got our food very quickly. The paninis were tasty and filling, and the coffee there is very good as well. No complaints!
author: Chris C.

description: The roasted yam panini is one of the most delicious things I've ever put in my mouth.  Perfect balance of salty, sweet, and fatty.  Carnivores are definitely missing out if you skip this sandwich.
author: LaSha G.

description: Hearty grubs.  3.5 star quality.  Good if you're in a hurry, and need a picnic lunch on the quick.  I had Nicole's sandwich.  It was decent enough.
author: Mark B.

description:
This place is great. The staff is super nice. The prices are great (sandwich with a side salad for $6-7). One of the best deals in the Haight as far as price goes.

The food isn't just cheap though, it's actually great stuff. Everything is fresh and flavorful. Oh, and the salad dressing is amazing. Fughettaboutit.
author: jared c.

description: Went here today after shopping in the Haight. Pretty good!! Got a French Panini. The little salad it comes with was a pleasant surprise as well.
author: Athina L.

description:
Walking down Haight street, my lady and I were not too sure on what to eat for lunch. I haven't had a panini for a while so we decided to give this place a shot.

They serve Lavazza coffee, which is pretty well known from Italy and their espressos have a thick crema..hence some of their Super Crema beans

But anyhow we went in for some paninis. I had the Caesar and it was not too shabby. Crunchy but soft bread, chicken, and provolone. My lady had the turkey dijon, which had some bacon, turkey, swiss and some dijon.

The place is small but cozy, but one thing that caught my eye was their health score..it was an 87 or 84!??! wtf!?!? how did you get an 80 something score...o well at least the paninis were good.
author: phillip w.

description: Had the Italiano and the Turkey Dijon.  I liked the side salad.  That was about it.  The sandwiches are a good size so they are definitely worth $7.  But they are very heavy on the cheese and I felt greasy after finishing my meal.  Service was great.
author: Jordan F.

description:
got the pesto chicken panini. $7.50
ordered really fast got the sandiwich in under 5 mins
came with a salad
good stuff!

the server/cashier/sandwichmaker guy was very nice too.

USE SCOUTMOB on ur iphone or android for 50% off!!!! 
i think til may2011
author: just k.

description:
best place i have had a panini at in the city
a very small little shop thats kind of unnoticeable 

tofunini is my number one choice. all the sandwiches come with a tasty/light salad.

not too expensive for how good it is :D
author: Adriana K.

description:
Yummy paninis.  I love the yam and feta panini.  The side salad is pretty tasty (when it isn't over-dressed) and they have a good selection of chips, treats, and beverages.  Unfortunately whenever I call to place an order the phone just rings and rings and rings.  When I am feeling patient I walk over and place my order and watch their weird info-TV.

Overall it is a pretty good lunch.  3.5 stars.
author: Sarah L.

description:
YUUUUUUUUM! 

Used to go to school a block away & this place has the best Paninis or Italian Sandwiches. My favorite is their Italiano which has Salami, Cheese, Tomato & some other stuff in it & it's sooooooooo good! Also their Chicken Arugula is my 2nd favorite & delicious as well!

Their sandwichs are perfect for 1 person or can be split between 2 if you're not that hungry. They're buttery, warm, and they give you a small salad on the side. 

Only downside is that it does cost about $6-8 a sandwich & it's not a gigantic portion. 

I LOVE IT THOUGH REGARDLESS!
author: Dessa S.

description:
I finally made my first visit to Panini last weekend. I've heard good reviews about this place from family members. I had the chicken arugula sandwich which was very good and tasty. I loved how the chicken was thinly sliced and the arugula gave the sandwich a nice mild spicy flavor. The panini sandwich reminded me of a fresh oven baked cookie; although it doesn't taste the same but the textures were there, nice and soft in the inside and crunchy texture on the outside. The panini comes with a side salad of fresh greens and the sandwiches are quite affordable which range between $6-7. 

 I would give this place 5 stars except they should've added more cheese to make it super cheesy. 

They had a great variety of chips, drinks, pastries.

A great place and I would go back to try all the paninis! Of course not all in one sitting.
author: Jenn S.

description:
Oh, Panini...seeing that every single review has given you 5 stars so far, I now feel like a turd giving you 4.  

Everything that's been said about the sandwiches are true - I had the Mediterraneo Cubanesco (queso fresco with tomatoes and dried herbs) and it was nearly divine (until I added just a touch of salt and a little more red wine vinegar at home - after that it was pure bliss).  A bunch of their other sandwiches called out to me too, it was a really hard decision - one that I will be making again.

The staff is very friendly and attentive, and wanted me to let them know what I thought, good or bad.   The prices are totally reasonable and was a major factor in my decision to go here in the first place.  I only have one complaint, and since everything else was excellent it's almost trivial...almost.  

I had no idea it came with salad.  I was very pleasantly surprised it did and thought it was a nice touch, however... :/

They put the salad in the same box with the piping hot sandwich.  Since it went in the same box, the salad got a little wilty and er, warm.  Not inedible mind you, in fact I did eat it later on after it aired out, and I loved the little tomatoes and greens they used.  But, salads and warm things in the same box don't survive bus rides too well, and for that reason I can't give it a 5 at this time.

However, I will be back here the next time I'm in the area, and I'll ask for a seperate container for the salad - if all goes well, I'll up the rating.
author: Sus... B.

description: I really like this place! I'm not sure if it is because I was super hungry, or that It took me so long to discover it, but my boyfriend and I were very satisfied... The paninis came out very hot, and the salad was super fresh. Not usually a fan of food on Haight, but I will definitely return!
author: KatieRae A.

description:
Ah, Panini.  You are so delicious, and open ridiculously early in the morning.

I like the sandwiches a lot, and they have some very creative vegetarian options such as The Brie, Tofunini, and Roasted Yams panini, for when I don't feel all meaty. They also have interesting salads sometimes, although they usually just get one or two at a time and once they're gone, they're gone. I also saw some yogurt-n-berries-n-granola-inna-cup that looked good last time I was there.

They're also friendly and quick, with cheap prices. $6 to $8 per sammich, and their pastries are reasonably priced too. There's nothing I don't like about this place.

Although, I would suggest that they stock up more on their tasty salads.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I came in here on the collective recommendation of Yelp.  I had hesitated about this place because I thought it was a chain, but I couldn't really substantiate the chain mental rumors I had started, so I gave it a try.

The place is clean, and the people who work here are attentive.  I won't say that they're nice, because I didn't get the nice vibe from them.  I generally don't like to be asked a lot of questions, especially at a place where you order at the counter, so the guy constantly asking me how things were got really old really fast.  I also don't understand why he informed me that I could sit down while I stood waiting for my sandwich.  So two stars for this guy.

I had the tofunini based on other Yelpers' recommendations, and I was very disappointed.  The bread is delicious, but the tofu is bland.  Very bland.  It's not gross, but I didn't really understand why I was supposed to like it.  Now, the salad that all the paninis come with is awesome.  I would highly recommend the salad, and I think they should make it clearer that all sandwiches come with salad.

The tables here are too narrow; it's as if there was a sale on oddly shaped tables at Ikea and this place bought out the stock.

I might come back, but I would need a pretty good reason to.
author: John S.

description:
Awesome sandwich. Simple as that.

I had the chicken pesto panini and the bread was seriously the best ever- hot, crispy, toasty.. Yum. My only complaint with the sandwich was that it's supposed to have sundried tomatoes but mine only had 2 puny ones.. I think they could have added more but I didn't want to bother them. 

The blonde girl who took my order was a bit rude though. I told her I was excited to try their food and that it was my first time and her response was," cool." No "welcome" or "yay" or you're in for a treat, but just a "cool" that came out of her nose. Oh well. Maybe she was having a bad day.

There's limited seating but you can easily find a nice place to sit on Haight. Great sandwich! Yay.
author: Joy A.

description:
These are great sandwiches! I hang out and eat up and down that block of Haight St. all the time, have been for years. While drinking at my favorite local tavern Trax Bar, I decided to have a sandwich from the new place. I've had about a dozen since.

The folks are great, the ingredients are good quality, and the sandwiches are not stingy with the stuffing. I've had the Italiano (really good, ask for extra tomato), the Nicole's Panini, and The Brie. All amazingly good. My friends have tried the veg/vegan type options and raved about them as well. 

If you're en route someplace and want to grab a sandwich, consider this place. If you come to belly up to the Pork Store, but can't stomach the line, hit the Panini place instead. 

Oh, and they have really good coffee--and the little side salad they give you without even telling you the sandwich comes with it is tastier than some mixed green salads I've paid for other places. 

I've even heard that if you're drinking at Trax (a few doors down), you can get a menu from behind the bar, call in the order, and they'll bring it to you.
author: kelly d.

description: Tiny restaurant. Moderate portions. Full of Flavor.
author: Sushi S.

description: Roasted yam panini with feta, balsamic and a garlic aioli? Yes. I've only strayed from this order once, and though it was delicious also, I don't think I can ever pass up the roasted yam. Staff has always been so sweet and takes the time to get to know their regulars. Some of the best coffee in Upper Haight, plus a (somewhat) extensive collection of European/ just cool candies (Hazelnut Kit-Kat, how are you not famous?). Pretty small with just a few tables, but only a few blocks from the steps at Buena Vista or Panhandle.
author: Kelsey K.

description: This is a great little coffee shop on Haight street. This place uses La Vazza coffee, which is a little treat from other places in San Francisco. The service is good, the cleanness is so-so,  and the prices are the standard prices at other coffee shops.  The breakfast muffins are very tasty.
author: Miranda m.

description: I had one of the best panini's I've ever had here!  It was some kind of chicken with pesto sandwich!  I'd definitely recommend this for a great lunch.  The price is great for the perfect panini!
author: Rachel M.

description: Got delivery here this afternoon, and was disappointed. Salad in box was wilted and the caprese panini I ordered was practically still cold. Cheese wasn't hot or melted at all and had a ton of balsamic soaked in the bread. Will look elsewhere for lunch next time...
author: Julie W.

description:
Stopped in for the Tofunini and it was REALLY good. The bread was crusty and soft inside, the tofu with the portobello and aioli really combined for a flavorful sandwich.  Price was fair for SF - $7.05 inc tax.  You also get a small salad with the sandwich.  
I ended up waiting maybe 10 minutes and the owner comped me my Italian soda.  What a sweet guy.  Chatty too - in a good way!  I'll def be back next time I'm in the hood.  
Go try it if you haven't already!
author: Lena W.

description:
Whoa!  this place is grrreat.  visiting san fran, my friend and i stumbled on this place while looking for a quick bite and MANN did we get something great!  they keep it simple and have the feeling of italy with the display case showing the fresh sandwiches ready to be panini pressed.  

our meals came with a small, unexpected, side salad that topped off our hunger until we bit into the crispy crust.

the price was reasonable (7ish), the seating was surprisingly comfortable, check this place out!
author: Mike V.

description:
Excellent Tofunini panini features a thick slice of richly textured tofu, marinated mushrooms, thin slivers of red onion, greens, and (hopefully) not too much mayo (most of the time) on grilled fresh focaccia.  I've brought friends, including one that normally doesn't eat vegetarian sandwiches, and they both loved it.

Will continue to be a fan of this good-sized sandwich with small side of balsamic greens as long as they have it.

Good service, though they occasionally serve up food out of order.
author: Dennis W.

description: Was a nice family-owned joint.  I had a tasty panini and salad.  The restaurant is definitely on the smallish side, but it's great for a quick meal and people watching.  I wish the sandwich had more avocado, but otherwise it was a good meal.
author: Judy C.

description:
I love this place!  The paninis are great - made with fresh ingredients and almost always grilled to perfection.  You also get a small basic salad on the side with a tasty vinaigrette.   

In my opinion they serve the best coffee in the upper haight (an area with a lot of coffee shops).  Stop by and get a Lavazza latte (especially good if George is the one to make it!).
author: Drea S.

description: Great customer service. The panini's and coffee are delicious! Also, don't forget try out their breakfast sandwiches.
author: Andre S.

description:
Attention to detail!

Initially myself, the BF and two other friends stopped in here so that we could use the restroom.  Being the awesome people we are, we purchased a few drinks so that we could then relieve ourselves.  

The guy behind the counter was SUPER AWESOME.  He discussed design elements that they had used and where we could find them.  One such elements was the 3 x 3 wood blocks on the Eastern wall.  They were beautiful!  It was so nice, I almost wanted to stay in Panini the whole day, never leaving.  One other reason for this was because of the music.  They were nice enough to offer burning me a copy of the CD that was playing that the time if I was to return in 30 minutes.  Of course, our B2B shopping got the best of us.  Returning an hour later, he was gone.  No prob, the gesture itself was primo!

I didn't have the chance to sample any of their mouth water treats, however everything looked fresh.  I'll be back and I know that I WON'T be disappointed!
author: Shane P.

description:
AMAZING.
 Wonderful people, so nice they even tucked a napkin in the to go box! Wait wasn't long for a to go order panini and everything was delicious! The perfect thing for the blue sky slightly breezy and warm san francisco day!
author: Camille D.

description:
I've eaten here probably a half dozen times and I've gotten in a rut of always ordering the same panini, The Mediterranean Cubanesco.  Yumm!  I love cheese and I've become addicted to the dried herbs on this sandwich.  I'm sure the rest of the menu is probably just as delicious, but I'm just lovin' this one so why chance it?

Customer service is always super friendly and and they seem to appreciate your business...a real treat in this neck of the woods.  The paninis arrive rather quickly of perfect temperature and crispiness and the accompanying salad is just perfect with yummy grape tomatoes on top.

Why not five stars, you ask?  Well, every time I have been there the tables need a good wipe down.  This is odd to me because they're never jam packed with customers or super busy when I'm there.  In fact, more often than not I see the workers/owners chillin' out out front or sitting at the tables themselves.  I suppose Panini is Haight St clean, but it's not five star clean.
author: Katy P.

description:
I worked on Haight for 2 years. The only place I would ever order from is Panini. And in those 2 years, I always ordered the Tofunini...much to the dismay of my coworkers who adored the Chicken Arugula, Chicken Pesto, etc. The first salad I got from there was not good at all...but in more recent times, when I've stolen bits from said coworkers, it was great--the Mozzarella is amazing. 

One complaint: it's not big enough!
author: Sarah H.

description: Really good! Relatively cheap with friendly service and fresh, hot paninis. The yam and feta one is totally unique and tasty, and like others, I was pleasantly surprised to get a tasty side salad with it. For about $7 you can't beat it. Oh, and they DO accept credit cards ...
author: Beth T.

description:
dear mr and mrs panini;
as fellow denizens of haight st, we as a buisness often buy our lunch from you.  but the woman working today was so rude, unsanitary, and foul that we will not be frequenting your establishment until you remove this person.  while we like you, your food, and your lovely family, as well as your prices and convenience, nothing will tempt as past your door again.  today, october 7th, at lunch time, the woman who served me threw my change at me, glowered while i waited for my lunch, and did not wash her hands or put up her hair- two things expereinced food servers automatically do.  please mr panini, please.
author: Kathleen R.

description: after a hard day of shopping through haight st, i wanted a good lunch. i passed by Panini and it was a cozy little cafe. They had unexpected sandwich combinations that i didn't think i would enjoy but i was feeling adventurous and had a prosciutto sandwich with melon and cheese. It was grilled perfectly with the cheese oozing out of the sides. Crispy toasted bread added texture while the melon complemented the sandwich saltiness of the prosciutto.  it was very good. It came with a salad that had this excellent balsamic vinagrette dressing. Good portion, good food, good price. Definitely check it out if you're there.
author: Laureen C.

description: The food is always very good and the owner and staff are friendly. A nice small salad comes with all the paninis. I recommend the Chicken Arugala. The coffee, which is Lavazza ("Italy's Favorite Coffee") and breakfast sandwiches are great as well!
author: Bob F.

description: I love the yam and feta panini!  I tried the tofu panini once too and it was good, but the yam is so moist and delicious I've been loyal to it since!  I live in the area and call in my order so it's ready to go when i walk in!
author: liz s.

description: This place is small and modest-looking - even kitschy - but its food certainly isn't!  I have loved every sandwich I've tried here, even though I was skeptical about the more adventurous options such as brie and cantaloupe.  The menu has a very nice vegetarian selection as well, which I often find more mouth watering than the rest - and I'm not a vegetarian!
author: Justin W.

description:
yam and feta panini is THE JAM!  after living in the area for a while i can't seem to find an appetite for anything except this yam panini dream!  

Coffee is delish too!   

good, cheap (for haight st) eats!  Can't go wrong there.
author: Kate H.

description:
2.5 stars
i was really disappointed...maybe i expected too much, and also the fact that i ordered thru waiters on wheels, it was not hot off the panini presses...but still, the tuna melt was merely a big ol scoop of mayonnaised-out tuna with a slice of kraft cheese melted atop, the roasted sweet yams panini was just ok, the yams were seasoned nicely, but the feta was kinda weird and i only wanted to eat half of it. the avo, spinach veg panini was decent, and the side salad was just ok... dont think ill ever order for the team at work again, but i would probably give them a second shot if i found myself wandering thru the Haight lookin for a grilled sammy...maybe not tho.

im sorry. i cant. dont hate me.
author: Kaylan S.

description: Every sandwich I've tried has been delicious.  The ingredients are SUPER fresh.  Once I called in an order, and they were out, so they ran to the organic market to get the missing ingredients.  Totally great customer service, and delicious food.
author: C B.

description: Best Panini I have ever had. And I have spent time in Italy, France, Switzerland and Germany where a panini was my fallback food of choice whenever I either didn't recognize other items on the menu or wanted to eat on the cheap. Well the sandwiches were cheap here too. None over $10. I walked down Haight trying to find a breakfast place and upon seeing the lines at the places next-door I thought I would settle for a sandwich instead. But Laura, Gina and I found that settling was not the appropriate term. We were lifted up by the friendly service, great sandwiches, complimentary salad and clean relaxing atmosphere. I thought I wanted a different kind of cheese on my panini, but the friendly girl at the counter convinced me that I was wrong. Boy was she right! I will come here again even though I don't live nearby.
author: Anna S.

description: This place is great! They are a 3 minute walk from my house, prices are right and the yam panini is super tasty and unique. Oh, and the chocolate dipped macaroons are the biz-o.
author: Abbey Y.

description:
I used to come here every morning before school, since I had school literally a block down the street.  I remember the first time I went there, I was walking around Haight desperate for a bagel and cream cheese, but I didn't have much money.  So first I went to "Coffee to the People" since it looked like a legit coffee place...but fuck me the prices are too high for a damn bagel...like I think it was $5 or $6 for a bagel&cream cheese...I'm sorry but I refuse.
So I left and walked down only a little bit and saw this small but clean looking cafe/sandwich place.
Immediately as I walk in I'm greeted by a nice looking girl.  So I look at the menu and to my excitement a toasted bagel&cream cheese was ONLY $2! Sooooo gooood!
So I got that.  And waited for only like 5min, which is a legit amount of wait time.  She gave it to me and was still very nice and polite.  Then I got scared..."maybe it is so cheap because they gyp you on the cream cheese."  So I cautiously opened up my little package and was SHOCKED...there was a crap load of cream cheese, YESS! just how I like it too :D
*two thumbs up*
author: Ashley R.

description: To be TOTALLY honest, we ONLY walked in there to buy a drink so we could use the facilities! However, after talking with guy working that day, we're totally gonna stop by every time we're in the Haight! He was COOL and very friendly and even offered to burn a copy of the CD that was playing at the time for the BF. And the Panini's looked and smelled SO good, too bad we weren't hungry at that point! Oh yeah, and they have Mexican Coke-a-Cola in the bottle, SO GOOD!!!!
author: Rob L.

description: I'm all about mozzarella tomato basil anything, so I can definitely say that the Caprese panini is absolutely incredible. It's a delicious, cheap sandwich and it comes with a balsamic vinaigrette salad -- all for $7. Such a great place for a decent price!
author: FA M.

description: I had a very pleasant experience eating there yesterday. The owner/manager was very warm and friendly. He made me feel very welcome. The meal was very tasty, but I ended up spending more than I planned on lunch. It wasn't his fault. I would probably eat there again next time I'm in the area.
author: Cathy P.

description: Honest food at a fair price!  And nice folks running the place.  Paninis are really good, as is the balsamic vinaigrette green salad that comes with!
author: Jim H.

description: Great paninis served w a little  side salad. Up and down Haight there are not too many options for food i would try but this is PERFECT for a quick bite to eat on the go. The tofu panini is delicious and super flavorful ! Their balsamic they serve on salad is wonderful. Overall a good experience.
author: Danielle L.

description: Bad trance and a mediocre panini.  I wouldn't be so harsh on the panini, but when I came in I saw the chicken pesto panini from the menu sitting underneath a glass display and initially thought it was a just a floor sample.  When I saw the floor sample slapped onto a Foreman grill I got a little worried, but calmed myself when I remembered that this was the cheapest sandwich place in the area.  After taking the first bite of the panini, I was pretty disappointed and realized that often you get what you pay for. The biggest pro to this place (at least on the day I was here) was the hot euro girls working behind the counter.
author: E-dough R.

description: Fresh mozzarella salad was awesome. Cute girl from New Zealand was so sweet, and offered substitutions when I asked her to hold the cranberries. My only complaint is that the mozzarella salad didn't have tomatoes. Who ever heard of fresh mozzarella without tomatoes?! But the blasalmic dressing was honestly the best I have ever had. The minus one star is for the lack of tomatoes, an also for the boss letting poor New Zealand girl man the place alone, causing service to be a little (understandably) slow.
author: Hale B.

description: When i first moved here this is where i went almost all the time to have a quick Caprese Sandwich. Being Italian my expectation of Italian food is very high. I was happy with my sandwich even though it was quite over priced. Sometimes the heart of the sandwich isn't completely hot and toasty which is why i put 3 stars instead of 4. The owner is a really nice guy. He's got a great sense of humor and is always happy and helpful. They got the music down too, it's loud radio with terrible music, just like the bars in Italy. Last but not least, the coffee is absolutely awful. Which for an Italian panini place is a disgrace. I'm sorry to say that but it's true. I still go here once in a while and still love the Caprese sandwich with a side of salad. Do go here if you haven't.
author: Waheguru Singh K.

description: MMmm Panini...This was my first food stop in the Haight and I was not disappointed.  The paninis are tasty, fresh, and made with love.  The owner of this place is fantastic.  I have experienced subtle rudeness from a few of the employees, but whenever boss-man is around, I am pumped.  Like I said, the paninis are delicious and the pastries are incredible.  They have a large variety of unique sandwiches.  I haven't tried one I don't like, although the chicken pesto is my favorite.  I don't think you can go wrong at this place...
author: Rochelle G.

description: this place was delicious, the frapuccino we got was really good, and the muffin was fresh and soft. the people that work here are nice but they kept talking to each other and didn't even ask if we wanted something else (which was the muffin) I'll definitely be going back to this spot if i'm on Haight St. again
author: Zito R.

description: Let me just say that I would fly back across the US right now for Panini. I lived in SF over the summer, and my roommates and I went to Panini numerous times because it was so delicious and in Haight, which is always a plus. I had a few of the sandwhiches, the Italian one and the Chicken pesto I remember..the Italian was my favorite! Soooo good. The staff were all so nice to us girls and even gave us a free dessert one time! Thumbs up to Panini.. i miss you!
author: Jane G.

description: omg, the sweet potato panini!!! i would never think to put sweet potato on a sandwich, let alone with feta. it's delicious though. genius!
author: Julia S.

description: Needed a quick bite to eat before a concert, and tried Panini after reading many Yelp reviews.  What a great find!  My picky husband was so impressed with the friendly owner, good food (he loved his tuna melt), and terrific coffee.  My choice of the yam & feta panini was also a winner, and the dressing on the side salad was as good as I read about in other reviews.  Other small but useful details:  clean restroom, good-sized servings, varied menu. We liked the family business aspect, and were surprised  to be comped a decadent 7-layer cookie with our meal!  We recommend Panini without reservation . . . just wish it would be open later (closes 8 p.m. Fri & Sat).
author: Patricia D.
